radiographic_examinations.procedure_name: CT scan and MRI of the brain
radiographic_examinations.findings: Two enhancing brain masses, one expanding and infiltrating the splenium of the corpus callosum and spreading into the parietal white matter bilaterally; a smaller mass in the right temporal and parietal lobes connecting with the main mass.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Initially isodense on CT; after contrast, intensely and uniformly enhanced with linear structures indicating spread through the Virchowâ€“Robin spaces; significant reduction in size, enhancement, and mass effect observed after treatment with high-dose methotrexate, with complete radiographic response six months later.

radiographic_examinations.findings: Marked decrease in size, enhancement, and mass effect of the splenial mass; adjacent edema and mass effect diminished.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Complete radiographic response after six months where earlier abnormal signals completely resolved.

radiographic_examinations.date: Four and a half years after initial presentation
radiographic_examinations.findings: New mass in the splenium of the corpus callosum that is mildly hyperintense and enhances after contrast administration.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Recurrence of primary CNS lymphoma identified.
